thread.title: Campervan caught on wrong side of double yellow lines in Manawatu Gorge
thread.title_full: Campervan caught on wrong side of double yellow lines in Manawatu Gorge

author: Kirsty Lawrence
title: Campervan caught on wrong side of double yellow lines in Manawatu Gorge
text:
Campervan caught on wrong side of double yellow lines in Manawatu Gorge KIRSTY LAWRENCE Last updated 18:52, February 20 2017 supplied 
A campervan was seen crossing the yellow lines in the Manawatu Gorge repeatedly. 
A motorist has described following a campervan through the Manawatu Gorge as "the scariest 15 minutes of road ever" after watching it repeatedly weave across the centre line. 
A motorist, who did not wish to be identified, reported the driver of the campervan to police after becoming increasingly concerned over his behaviour. 
Images sent to Stuff show the campervan travelling almost completely on the wrong side of the road as it navigated through the windy gorge about 6pm on Sunday. supplied 
A motorist reported the driver of this campervan to police. 
The gorge has double yellow lines throughout. 
"They started off kind of drifting over the centre line at the start of the gorge, on corners. 
"By the end of the gorge, they seemed confident enough to be on the complete other side of the road just before blind corners. 
"[It was the] scariest 15 minutes of road ever." 
She said they kept their distance from the campervan in fear of a crash. 
"When cars were coming towards them they barely went back over to the left. 
"Manawatu Gorge is an incredibly narrow piece of road and anyone who takes it very often knows that you can't go quickly and you have to be careful on the corners and if a very large vehicle, like a campervan, comes towards you there is no where to get out of the way." Ad Feedback 
The campervan turned off at the end of the gorge and the motorist said they saw three young people in the front. 
The issue is not a new one for the gorge. In 2006, officers with cameras were stationed along the stretch of road, catching 40 motorists crossing the centre line in just six hours. 
At the time, police said they were shocked at the number of people with no regard for double yellow lines. - Stuff
